        public void setAuthenticator(IUserAuthenticator auth)

        The context

      • setSSLContext

        public void setSSLContext(javax.net.ssl.SSLContext ssl)
        Sets the SSL context for secure connections. This is required for supporting TLS/SLL.
        Parameters:
        ssl - The context

      • setExplicitSSL

        public void setExplicitSSL(boolean explicit)
        Sets whether the security will be explicit or implicit. A server in explicit mode will support both secure and insecure connections. A server in implicit mode will only support secure connections. In order to support SSL, a context must be given with setSSLContext(SSLContext)
        Parameters:
        explicit - true to support all connections, false otherwise

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int idleTimeout)
        Sets the idle timeout in milliseconds Connections that are idle (no commands or transfers) for the specified time will be disconnected. The default and recommended time is 5 minutes.
        Parameters:
        idleTimeout - The time in milliseconds

      • setBufferSize

        public void setBufferSize(int bufferSize)
        Sets the default buffer size in bytes The default value is 1024 bytes
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - The buffer size in bytes

        public void listen(int port)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Starts the FTP server asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        port - The server port
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When an error occurs while starting the server

      • listen

        public void listen(java.net.InetAddress address,
                   int port)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Starts the FTP server asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        address - The server address or null for a local address
        port - The server port or 0 to automatically allocate the port
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When an error occurs while starting the server

      • listenSync

        public void listenSync(int port)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Starts the FTP server synchronously, blocking the current thread. Connections to the server will still create new threads.
        Parameters:
        port - The server port
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When an error occurs while starting the server

      • listenSync

        public void listenSync(java.net.InetAddress address,
                       int port)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Starts the FTP server synchronously, blocking the current thread. Connections to the server will still create new threads.
        Parameters:
        address - The server address or null for a local address
        port - The server port or 0 to automatically allocate the port
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When an error occurs while starting the server
